edu.rpi.tw.data.rdf.sesame.query.impl

Class DefaultQuerylet<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rpi.tw.data.rdf.sesame.query.impl.DefaultQuerylet<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BindingHandler, Querylet<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdditionalDescriptionsQuerylet, CellBasedSubjectOutPredicateQuerylet, CellDelimiterQuerylet, CharsetQuerylet, ColumnEnhancementQuerylet, DefaultDoubleSetQuerylet, DefaultIntegerSetQuerylet, DefaultLongSetQuerylet, DefaultSPOIterableQuerylet, DefaultStringQuerylet, DefaultURIQuerylet, DefaultURISetQuerylet, DomainTemplateQuerylet, FocusedQuerylet, FRBRStackQuerylet, HumanRedirectQuerylet, IdentifierNamesI18NQuerylet, InterpretedAsQuerylet, LargeValueQuerylet, LayerDatasetDescriptionsQuerylet, MultipleHeadersReferencesQuerylet, OldNamespaceQuerylet, PrefixMappingsQuerylet, PrimaryKeyColumnQuerylet, RepeatPreviousSymbolQuerylet, RowQuerylet, SubClassOfQuerylet, URLSourceUsageQuerylet

    public abstract class DefaultQuerylet<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Querylet<T>
    An implementation of the Querylet interface that stores the context to query and the Namespaces required for a query's graph pattern. Reports that it returns SPARQL query strings by default, can override for other languages.

      • getContexts

        public static java.util.Set<org.openrdf.model.Resource> getContexts(java.lang.String[] args,
                                                    int startIndex,
                                                    org.openrdf.repository.Repository repository)
        Process 'args' for a set of contexts.
        Parameters:
        args - - the arguments to a main()
        startIndex - - the first index of 'args' that names a context.
        repository - - an initialized repository from which to get contexts if none found in 'args'.
        Returns:
        a set of contexts from args; if args empty populate with all contexts from 'repository'.
